column5: Someone was asking about pike in deeper water, try this lure
On 4" of black ice...    Tried to get some action shots last fall none turned out very well.
[/img]  This one is from last week.
from my iPhone fishing solo...great thread
Watching the big girls heading back to swim another day is the best kind of action for me
very nice, how can you guys get all these nice action photos? you guys must have a photographer by your side all the time?
Very, very cool photo!
Wow...all fantastic.  That laker shot is my favourite!
Air muskie... pic taken out of a video clip so not great quality
Here a few to add to the collection....only problem is....they arent attached to anything
Feisty Lake Trout from this weekend
Awesome thread Chad!!!  Juli and I will see if we can dig some up
I agree Rick. Dave you have some awesome shots.
Lots of great pics from everyone! This one is super cool, nice job Doug!  This photo wasn't retouched at all. If it had been properly centered it really would have been something special.
This thread is great .... definitely inspiring me to try for more action shots....have a nice jumping muskie somewhere....but I think it's on actual film.
Hahaha. That's the one I nearly caught as it randomly jumped into the boat, right..haha.  Great shot
Cool! What kind of fish are these? Shads??
A couple of my favs.
Not mine.  Bald eagle steals fish from angler http://media.zenfs.com/en/blogs/thesideshow/RickWarrenEagle.jpg
This one makes me laugh
Taken by a friend on our last sturgeon trip west.
Probably the best shot I've ever taken, lol!   Dinner! by billmarz, on Flickr  Another decent one...   Saugeen River Resident by billmarz, on Flickr  Drew, those sturgeon shots are off the hook!!!!

This one was from September 2009, my sister's boyfriend walked over (they were swimming) and took this picture as I battled that gar:  These were from last week while I guided my friend for some more gar (he got his 1st two ever, which are featured here), his girlfriend took some good shots

This is a great idea for a post! Great photos so far but my favourite one so far is the second shot of the sturgeon jumping. Just awesome!   Algonquin Laker  Fighting Lake Trout by nickkuchmak, on Flickr  Rainbow Relealsed   DSC_0559hue by nickkuchmak, on Flickr  Tailing a large char in Nunavut   Tailing a Big One by nickkuchmak, on Flickr
I was just laughing at how lucky I got with that shot, it definitely was taken by me
Here is a musky from Balsam that I lost next to the boat, but my buddy managed a few pics and video of it. High 40's maybe a 50 completely out of water was awesome to watch.
Fish hit!!
After seeing TDunn's post...the one with the sweet photo of the speckled trout pushing water, I figured it would cool for us to compile our collective "action shots" in one thread.
ok ill play along    I think MJL has a kewl shot of a steelie jumping on the end of a line....
Me too!!!
Remember this one?   I like this one as well...
Brookie by billmarz, on Flickr   Steel. by billmarz, on Flickr
I believe you mean this one (Yes, MJL took it)?  I happen to have it as I was attached to the other end of the line.      Uploaded with ImageShack.us   Some great shots above!
Steelhead      Laker
Thats the one i was thinking about Spiel  MJL- SHOW OFF!
great shots above!! Love the "laker down the hole" shot
Old salmon action shot with a disposable camera from 15 odd years ago.
My son at Eddie North's. A 43" pike
nice shot Skud
A couple more from the weekend.
K...I hate all you guys
This isn't a great shot but was a decent smallie shot I got while catching it on the fly rod.    This isn't a fish but a cool shot I got of a beaver diving, while up north.
i was gonna say, if that beaver shot was actually a fish...that's a STRONG fish!!
Muuuusky....
AWESOME Musky!
Here's an awesome pic my girlfriend took on the french river this weekend.
Perfect, close-up action shot

captured these with my phone, wish i had, had my point and shoot with me that day.
